comments:
Simply select a remote folder to copy. Than select a local directory, Ex. desktop, to paste. It says:

An internal error occured during: "Transfer Operation"

-----------Enter bugs above this line-----------
TM 2.0M6 Testing
installation : eclipse-platform-3.3M6 CDT-4.0M6
RSE install  : update-site RSE-runtime-all
java.runtime : Sun 1.6.0-b105
os.name:     : Windows XP 5.1, Service Pack 2
------------------------------------------------
systemtype   : Unix-ssh
targetos     : Open SUSE LINUX 10.2 (i586)
targetuname  : Linux linux-sbko 2.6.18.2-34-default #1 SMP Mon Nov 27 11:46:27 UTC 2006 i686 i686 i386 GNU/Linux
targetvm     : Sun Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_08-b03, mixed mode)
------------------------------------------------
Also it sometimes does nothing with saying nothing when you try to copy a remote file into another remote or local

Burak, do you have an error log entry with an exception for this?
Either via 
   Window > SHow View > PDE Runtime > Error Log, 
or via
   Help > About > Configuration Details > View Error Log

Here is the error log.
----------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2007-04-04 08:52:42.078
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Transfer Operation".
!STACK 0
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 0, Size: 0
	at java.util.ArrayList.RangeCheck(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.ArrayList.get(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.rse.core.model.AbstractSystemResourceSet.get(AbstractSystemResourceSet.java:61)
	at org.eclipse.rse.internal.files.ui.view.SystemViewRemoteFileAdapter.validateDrop(SystemViewRemoteFileAdapter.java:1318)
	at org.eclipse.rse.internal.ui.view.SystemDNDTransferRunnable.transferRSEResources(SystemDNDTransferRunnable.java:194)
	at org.eclipse.rse.internal.ui.view.SystemDNDTransferRunnable.runInWorkspace(SystemDNDTransferRunnable.java:572)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:38)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
I think this is really important for M6.
I haven't been able to reproduce this.  Martin, does it happen when you try?

I also cannot reproduce this with I20070405-0600. I only found bug 181197 along the way (correctly transferred but "Empty List" displayed).

Burak - I cannot quite understand your instructions. What did you mean by "Paste to Desktop"? Pasting to Windows Explorer or Windows Desktop does not work for me. Could you re-try with I20070405-0600 or be more specific?

Dave - does the traceback tell you anything?

Created an attachment (id=63036)
Steps to reproduce (Capture)

Please see attached capture of what I do. It is 100% reproducible on my environment.

Burak: Thanks for the screen capture. I tried very hard but I still cannot reproduce it. I tried doing exactly as you, SSH -> Local. With an empty directory, or one with exactly one file. Browsing into the folder or not -- I just cannot reproduce it.

Did you make the screen capture with I20070405-0600?

I really have no idea what's going on here. Could it be that in your desktop, a file with this name (but different uppercase/lowercase) already exists? Could it be that the remote file is actually stale because you deleted it outside RSE? Any more hints are helpful.

I'm decreasing severity to NORMAL since it looks like you're the only one who hits this.

Burak - this is probably fixed by the fix for bug 181197 (avoid refresh event for file transfer when create event already sent).

Could you re-test with the I20070405-1810 build?

Thanks!

I tried it with the latest and it still exists on my environment.

However, I have another vm windows machine for some testing purposes and I tried it on that machine and as you said, there is no problem at all.

Should I reinstall my computer? :)

Anyway, I'll try to find the possible reasons for this when I have time.
It must be something about my workspace. Any other workspace I use or new created works just fine.
Perhaps this is related to bug 181553 and you still have some stale deleted files in the cache. Dave - any other ideas?

My guess is there's a problem in the temp files cache.  It would be an interesting experiment to backup the RemoteSystemTempFiles project and then clear the cache to confirm whether it's related to the cache.
Burak can you ZIP up the RemoteSystemsTempFiles project, delete its contents (keeping the directory and the .project file intact!) and then retry?

I have tried but no change. 

I think, it is about something in my .metadata directory which is 1.5GB for now :)
Are you able to edit the files that you're trying to copy?  If not, then the problem is likely to do with the download.
I haven't heard any response to this for a while.  Is this still a problem?

I have not seen the problem for a while. You'd better close it if it is not reproducible.

Regards,
Burak
marking this as worksfor me since no has been able to reproduce it recently.
